paper: LoCoT2V-Bench_ A Benchmark for Long-Form and Complex Text-to-Video Generation

alignment.note: The AI review shows very high coverage of the paper's strengths but has low coverage of its weaknesses, missing several major points raised by human reviewers (e.g., no evaluation on ground-truth videos, limited model scope). The AI also introduces several valid, distinct concerns regarding reproducibility and statistical analysis not mentioned by the human reviewers.

The AI review correctly identifies all key strengths but misses several substantive critiques raised by humans, including the lack of ground-truth evaluation, the absence of closed-source/SOTA baselines, and missing related work. While the AI overlooks these points, it introduces valid technical concerns regarding output length standardization and metric normalization that the human reviewers did not mention.

The AI review captures all the paper's strengths but misses several substantive weaknesses raised by multiple human reviewers, including the exclusion of closed-source models, the lack of ground-truth evaluation, and the limitation of dynamics metrics to frame-level analysis. While the AI introduces valid technical critiques regarding reproducibility and normalization details, it overlooks broader methodological concerns like missing related work and the choice of alignment metrics.

The AI review shows very high coverage of the paper's strengths but low coverage of its weaknesses. The AI missed several key human concerns, including the lack of evaluation on ground-truth videos, the limited scope of models tested (no SOTA), and specific issues with the metrics (e.g., overlooking higher-level dynamics).
